H0.text: Lever, pulley, and wedge are the simple machines that Ana used when she rolled her wagon down the ramp to reach the playground and then played on the seesaw with her sister.

H1.text: Pulley, inclined plane, and screw are the simple machines Ana used when she rolled her wagon down the ramp to reach the playground and played on the seesaw.

H2.text: Wedge, wheel and axle, and screw are the simple machines Ana used when she rolled her wagon down the ramp to reach the playground and then played on the seesaw with her sister.

H3.text: Wheel and axle, inclined plane, and lever are the simple machines Ana used when she rolled her wagon down the ramp to reach the playground and then played on the seesaw with her sister.

A4.text: A lever is a simple machine consisting of a beam or rigid rod pivoted at a fixed hinge, or fulcrum.

A5.text: A lever amplifies an input force to provide a greater output force, which is said to provide leverage, which is mechanical advantage gained in the system, equal to the ratio of the output force to the input force.
